name: Carnival
description:
Carnival is a fixed shooter released by Sega in arcades in 1980. It has the distinction of being the first video game with a bonus round.

Carnival was ported to the Atari 2600, ColecoVision, and Intellivision. An Atari 8-bit family version was published in 1982 by ANALOG Software, the commercial software label of ANALOG Computing magazine.
